intro: Ditassa myriantha, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of branches. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
